channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for KS

item.title: Report E-2024030473
item.description:
Report E-2024030473

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-27T15:12:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-22
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XKC experienced a UN3266 Flash Clene 1414 release from a 330-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 0.5 cup of product released to a 1’ x 1’ area of the poly tote body due to a crack on the top corner of the tote. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with absorbents, pads, and PPE into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024030887
item.description:
Report X-2024030887

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-22T18:13:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-14
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: While a package handler was pulling packages out of the IC belt, he noticed that a package was on its side and with a wet corner. he told his manger. DescribePack: because the package was on its side one bottle leaked out about one or two ounces. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: the manager called QA and QA went to the area pick the package and brought to the processing cage.

item.title: Report X-2024030770
item.description:
Report X-2024030770

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-22T18:13:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-11
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: MANAGER NOTICED THE PACKAGE WAS LEAKING AND NOTIFIED QA. QA PLACED THE PACKAGE IN A LINED TOTE AND CLEANED UP THE SPILL. THE PACKAGE WAS THEN TAKEN TO THE PROCESSING CAGE. DescribePack: ONE BOTTLE WAS LEAKING OUT FROM AROUND THE CAP AND SOILED THE BOX. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A LINED TOTE.

item.title: Report I-2024020006
item.description:
Report I-2024020006

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-27T15:12:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-18
  • City: SALINA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: HIGH PRESSURE TRANSPORTS LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Our truck and trailer was getting washed at Blue Beacon in Salina, KS. During the wash, one of the valves must have been accidentally turned or hit causing the line to fill up with vapor and then come out of the top of the trailer. After the release was noticed the employees stepped outside as the driver moved the truck and trailer outside. When the driver got outside he went back to trying to fix the trailer until the release had stopped.
